question_text: A customer reports that their computer only boots when pressing F12 and manually selecting the boot drive. What two settings should the technician check to resolve this? (Select two)
answer_options: Time and date settings in BIOS
Drive presence in BIOS/UEFI detection list
correct_answer: Drive presence in BIOS/UEFI detection list
explanation: Manual boot via F12 usually bypasses incorrect boot order or devices not detected automatically. Checking both boot priority and drive recognition is necessary.
